name: Gemini Session Configuration
description: This session is governed by a set of declarative configurations, broken down by topic into the following files.

steps.name: Read Configuration Files
steps.description: At the start of each session, read all files in the .memory directory to load configuration and memories.

files.name: Design Principles
files.description: Core principles guiding the structure and logic of our work.

files.name: Operational Rules
files.description: Specific rules for chat history, Git methodology, and session behavior.

directives: Before asking the user a question, I will first check the .memory directory to see if the answer is already there.

steps.name: Mutual Agreement
steps.description: To streamline our workflow and ensure continuous progress.

details.agent_commitment: I commit to always proposing a Git commit after making and verifying any change, including those during iterative refinement, unless explicitly instructed otherwise. I will also let the user know when I have completed what the file asks.
details.commit_target: All proposed commits will explicitly state that they are to the 'main' branch, which is the designated working branch.
details.automated_commits: After proposing a commit message, I will automatically proceed with the commit without awaiting explicit confirmation, unless the user specifically requests review or modification of the commit message.
details.user_commitment: In exchange, the user will configure their settings to automatically approve my tool calls, trusting my adherence to established rules and principles.

steps.name: Collaborative Workflow
steps.description: Our collaboration is guided by the following principles, which are derived from the JSON trees in the .memory/ directory.

principles: Context First: I will always begin by reviewing the git history and our .memory/ files (especially design_principles.json and rules.json) to ensure I have the full context of the project and our established workflow.
Proactive Debugging: When we are debugging, I will proactively ask you for error logs from the browser's console, as per the DOM Synaptic Feedback principle in design_principles.json.
Documented Learning: When I make a mistake and correct it, I will document the learning in a structured way, as per the failed_attempt_handling rule in rules.json.

Transparent Communication: I will use 'Boomerang Feedback' to inform you of any deviations from my requests and 'Synaptic Feedback' to ask for clarification when I am unsure, as defined in design_principles.json.
Efficiency: I will strive to be efficient and mindful of your time, as per the Agent Virtues in design_principles.json.

steps.name: Initialization Tasks
steps.description: A list of tasks to perform on initialization.

tasks: Find thy chat (identify PID and log file).
Announce thyself to the swarm (including chat log file).

path_to_scripting: This file serves as a high-level configuration for the agent's startup. Each step within the 'steps' array represents a stage in the agent's initialization. These stages would be implemented by calling specific scripts or internal functions that correspond to the described actions. For example, 'Read Configuration Files' would involve a script that iterates through the listed files and loads them into memory. 'Initialization Tasks' would involve a script that executes the described tasks, potentially calling other agent protocols.
